DataElement.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Distant Metastasis M Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the distant metastasis for esophageal and esophagogastric junction carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.  This staging system applies to carcinomas including undifferentiated carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancers, adenosquamous carcinoma, and adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features.  Sarcomas, nonepithelial cancers, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors are not staged using this staging system.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to pathologic M stage of or relating to the esophagus.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Of or relating to the esophagus.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: Of or relating to the esophagus.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: Pathologic; caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  M refers to the presence of metastasis.

Concepts.definition: Caused by or altered by or manifesting disease or pathology.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 9/24/18 tt received permission to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards/BC.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Esophagus and Esophagogastric Junction Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Edition 8 M Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A finding about one or more characteristics of esophagus and esophagogastric junction cancer, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system. This staging system applies to carcinomas including squamous cell carcinoma, adenocarcinoma, adenosquamous carcinoma, undifferentiated carcinoma, neuroendocrine cancers, and adenocarcinoma with neuroendocrine features. Sarcomas, nonepithelial cancers, and gastrointestinal stromal tumors are not staged using this staging system. (from AJCC 8th Ed.)_One criteria of the TNM staging system. M refers to the presence of metastasis._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.
